document.heading: District of Columbia Protective Services Police Identification Act of 1982

history.narrative: Law 4-115, the “District of Columbia Protective Services Police Identification Act of 1982,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 4-379, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 23, 1982, and April 6, 1982, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 12, 1982, it was assigned Act No. 4-178 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
